CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Wrecked Meat Case - Glass in the above empty and unused meat case, in the front room of 1622 Centre Ave., was shattered last Thursday by Superintendent of Police James Slosser's special racket squad, after a woman had been arrested for numbers in the back room of the storeroom. Damaging the meat case failed to produce numbers slips or money. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Interior of small grocery store with broken meat case after police raid, 1622 Centre Avenue, Hill District
